name: vscode-boot-dev-pack
description: A collection of extensions for developing Spring Boot applications

walkthroughs.title: Getting Started with Spring Boot in VS Code
walkthroughs.description: An Overview of the Spring Tools in VS Code to get started and to work with existing Spring Boot projects in VS Code

steps.title: Create a new Spring Boot project
steps.description:
The easiest way to create new Spring Boot projects in VS Code is to use the Spring Initializr integration. Open the command palette in VS Code, search for __Spring__ and create a new Spring Boot project from there.
[Create New Spring Boot Project](command:spring.initializr.maven-project)

media.altText: Create a new Maven-based Spring Boot project

steps.title: Navigate your Spring Boot projects
steps.description:
The Spring Tools in your VS Code installation contribute Spring-specific symbols to help you navigate your projects. All the symbols start with `@`.
You can navigate to the symbols using the [Outline View](command:outline.focus) of the current file, via the [Go to Symbol in Editor...](command:workbench.action.gotoSymbol) or globally via [Go to symbol in Workspace...](command:workbench.action.showAllSymbols).
If you start your search with an `@`, the list of symbols will show the Spring-specific symbols only.

steps.title: Run your Spring Boot projects
steps.description:
Running your Spring Boot projects from within VS Code is simple: Open any Java source file from your project and press `Run` at the top right corner.
The second option is to [switch to the launch section](command:workbench.view.debug) of VS Code and start the app there.

steps.title: Show live information from your running Spring Boot application
steps.description: A unique feature of the Spring Tools is the ability to vizualize live data from your running app inplace with the source code of the running application.
